sentences: Virtual Pricing Director (VPD) is hiring a remote full-stack engineer to help develop the application and back-end of our groundbreaking cloud based legaltech

We’re a well-funded scaleup (no VC money) with big plans; our software enables law firms to better understand and fairly price their fees and to reduce arbitrary pricing and other bad practices that have existed for years
You'll be joining at an exciting time - as we make our first major deployments to leading law firms
The work is varied, challenging, and we place equal emphasis on front and back-end; we need to deliver scheduled features, fix bugs, and respond to the needs of newly onboarded firms

You'll be building integrated applications, APIs and framework components which underpin our platform, and this'll entail interesting complexity across the back-end, data workflow and front-end, contributing code that's well-implemented, robust and that scales
We offer considerable freedom in technology choice and approach
There are big plans and lots to accomplish
A flavour of the work
Build exciting new features from our extensive road map
Recommend and implement improvements to application flow and user experience
Build tools to improve developer experience
Improve our automation and QA processes
Extend the internal APIs to allow customers to change core data and config via admin screens
Surface key metrics and status’ on back end processes like integration and data sync status to alert customers and the VPD tech team to any potential issues
Extend our external API capability to ensure the flow of data from customers's Practice Management Systems evolves to keep pace with any new features
Qualities and skills sought
A solid technical understanding of software engineering principles accrued in a modern web application context
Adept with React, TypeScript, Node
js, PostgreSQL (or similar), GraphQL, CI/CD pipelines
Proficient with ORM tools like Prisma, Sequelize or TypeORM
Ability to unpack complex requirements, to uphold security of sensitive data and to conform to best practices
Comfortable with autonomy and taking a self-starting approach to closing gaps in our systems, processes and documentation
An ability to analyse, diagnose and resolve live issues - be that in the data, the application or the platform
A collaborative, adaptable and user-centred approach
Comfortable working in an Agile environment
A desire to proactively and positively challenge the status quo and search for continual improvements to processes and ways of working
Our current stack - we'll help you get up to speed
TypeScript | Node
js | React | PostgreSQL | Apollo Client | Apollo Server | GraphQL | Prisma | Docker | Heroku | Auth0 | AWS | Microservices
You may also bring - or like to learn within the role

Heroku | Auth0 | message queues | integrating with external systems | Redis | E2E Testing | load & stress testing | Linux distributions | Gitlab CI/CD | WebSockets | Serverless | TurboRepo | Type-GraphQL
Salary and benefits
£70,000 - £90,000 - we're keeping an open mind
Fully remote | flexible hours | work from home or shared office
25 days holiday, plus public holidays and a day for your birthday
Flexible working practices - tell us what you need
Personal development plan that you can shape, with budget for related training/certifications
About us

VPD has developed groundbreaking software, automating, for the first time, the fundamental elements of legal pricing into a product that creates high-quality pricing proposals in a fraction of the time
We are the authority for legal pricing and our software has attracted the attention of the largest firms in numerous countries, with a number of partnerships and customers signed
We're now strengthening our fully-remote development team, offering a culture where you may work under your own initiative towards common goals
It's an opportunity to be a formative team member, joining a friendly flat-structured team that operates without ego, and to grow and improve together

Hiring process - all remote:  40 mins chat with team and a mini coding challenge; if that's gone well a take-home exercise; then final interview and chat with co-founder
